intro: Phiambolia francisci, commonly known as the Franchet's phiambolia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Phiambolia francisci has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
